messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] cool...thanks
messages.msgSnippet: Sharon, Of course you can keep your cool !!! Nobody can take it away, its in the way that you deal with people and people can sense it. They are drawn to it.
messages.messageBody:
Sharon,
Of course you can keep your cool !!! Nobody can take it away, its in the way
that you deal with people and people can sense it. They are drawn to it.
BYW its very hard to be cool for your own kids. I bet all of his friends
thought you were cool!!

LOL!! Go figure
Tamie

messages.subject: cool...thanks
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Tami I remember son #2 asking me to not cheer for him at a ball game becuase people might look at me. I wasn t cool. I can t tell you how flattered I am.
messages.messageBody:
Dear Tami

I remember son #2 asking me to not cheer for him at a
ball game becuase people might look at me. I wasn't
cool.

I can't tell you how flattered I am. A younge person
calling me "cool"!! I think I'll do a little dance.

Thanks Sharon

ps I know I won't be able to always "keep my cool"
though! Ha!

__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] basic skills tutoring in high school
messages.msgSnippet: Diane, your email addy is beside your name. You can send Sharon a note to her email addy(It is beside her name)! Sharon by the way is rather cool,kind and very
messages.messageBody:
Diane,
your email addy is beside your name. You can send Sharon a note to her email
addy(It is beside her name)! Sharon by the way is rather cool,kind and very
cool! (I am sure you already noticed her kind way!)
Tami

>Thanks,
>Diana Tashjian
